name: proposal
description: Professional service contract proposal for external clients

inputs.label: Recipient Name
inputs.description: Full name of primary recipient (e.g., 'Bridgette Hunter, CEO')

inputs.label: Recipient Organization
inputs.description: Client organization name

inputs.label: Recipient Address
inputs.description: Full mailing address

inputs.label: Cover Letter Context
inputs.description: Background from prior discussions - their challenges, what they emphasized

inputs.label: Client Pain Points
inputs.description: Specific problems client is trying to solve (bullet list)

inputs.label: Your Solution Summary
inputs.description: Brief overview of what you're proposing (2-3 bullets)

inputs.label: Your Qualifications
inputs.description: Why you're uniquely qualified (experience, expertise, differentiators)

inputs.label: Executive Summary - Client Situation
inputs.description: Paragraph 1: Client's situation, patient population, current gaps

inputs.label: Executive Summary - Your Solution
inputs.description: Paragraph 2: Your proposed model, key components

inputs.label: Executive Summary - Value Proposition
inputs.description: Paragraph 3: Why your company, relevant experience, how you integrate

inputs.label: Key Benefits
inputs.description: 4-5 specific, measurable benefits (one per line)

inputs.label: Your Experience & Credentials
inputs.description: Your organization's background, years in business, relevant experience

inputs.label: Phase 1: Mobilization & Onboarding
inputs.description: Activities for startup phase

inputs.label: Phase 2: Service Delivery
inputs.description: Core service delivery details - staffing, coverage, responsibilities

inputs.label: Phase 3: Performance & Quality
inputs.description: Quality monitoring, review meetings, performance tracking

inputs.label: Deliverables
inputs.description: Specific deliverables client will receive (bullet list)

inputs.label: Client Responsibilities
inputs.description: What client needs to provide (bullet list)

inputs.label: Pricing Model
inputs.description: E.g., '$1,000 per day' or 'Annual fee of $X'

inputs.label: Pricing Description
inputs.description: What's included in the price, payment terms

inputs.label: Scope of Services Included
inputs.description: What IS included in the agreement (bullet list)

inputs.label: Out of Scope
inputs.description: What is NOT included (bullet list)

inputs.label: Contract Term
inputs.description: E.g., 'One (1) year from effective date'

inputs.label: Your Company Name
inputs.description: Your organization's legal name

inputs.label: Signatories
inputs.description: Names, titles, credentials of people who will sign (one per line)

verification_questions.question: Does the cover letter reference specific client challenges from prior discussions?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Reference specific challenges from prior discussions in the cover letter.

verification_questions.question: Are all benefits specific and measurable (not vague)?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Make benefits specific with concrete metrics and outcomes.

verification_questions.question: Is the statement of work detailed with clear phases and deliverables?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Add specific activities, timelines, and deliverables to each phase.

verification_questions.question: Are pricing and terms crystal clear?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Clearly state pricing structure, payment terms, and contract duration.

verification_questions.question: Does the proposal demonstrate understanding of client's specific needs?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Reference specific client pain points and how your solution addresses them.

verification_questions.question: Are all team member names, credentials, and experience claims verifiable in the provided inputs? (No hallucinated people or credentials)
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Remove or use generic language for any names, credentials, or experience not explicitly provided in the 'Your Qualifications' input. Use phrases like 'Our team of experienced professionals' instead of invented names.

verification_questions.question: Are all numerical claims (costs, metrics, percentages, timelines) grounded in the provided inputs or explicit in your organization's known data?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Remove or soften any numbers not explicitly provided (e.g., change '40% cost reduction' to 'significant cost reduction' if not stated). Use only verifiable metrics.

criteria.name: Client Focus
criteria.description: Demonstrates deep understanding of client needs

excellent.description: Specific references to client challenges throughout

criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: All necessary sections with sufficient detail
